content.description:
This route is between Lichen to Fly and Elmo, third route from the left (starting at Outermost Limits).

Start in the overhang and follow bolts to crack, then break off to the Lichen anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts to dirty hand crack, fight the vegetation. Gear from #1 BD C3 to #1 BD C4 is fine to protect the crack, then 1 bolt on Lichen to anchors.

content.description: Fun climb with a crux that can be seen as dangerous....
content.location:
Located on the

Outermost Limits Wall

.

content.description: Starts up a slab and then goes through a roof to an interesting bombay-ish feature. Next step right and pull some more roofs.
content.protection: Quickdraws and chain anchors. The hanger on the first bolt may be missing?
content.location: This is the last climb uphill, with a large tree at the base. Look for bolts headed up towards a roof.

content.description: A great warm up and good climb for beginners. Good pro and a very clean face. Starts up horizontal cracks to a thin face above.
content.protection: Singles of small to medium cams, quickdraws, chain anchors.
content.location: This is the first climb you will come to as you cross the creek to the wall. Starts just right of the big overhang, on a large block.

content.description: Starts up a steep face to a small overhang and then continues straight up.
content.location: This is the second route headed uphill, it is marked by a chain hanging over a lip on the 2nd bolt (extension for the bolt).

content.description: This gear line starts by climbing the bouldery moves to a ledge left of Outermost Limits. From the ledge, place protection out right and traverse into the main event on steep flat holds leading right. Place gear when you can get it, and then traverse back left making moves on sloping edges, underclings, and finger jams. Hold back the pump, and mantle onto the ledge.
content.protection:
Gear: Small wires, 1 00tcu, 2 0 c3's. A crash pad may be a good idea for protecting potential ground falls.

Anchors: There are 2 old button head bolts that were used to lower off from an old route climbing in from further left. The route will be further equipped fall 2015.
content.location: The start is the obvious orange lichen streaked face, left of the arete to the left of Outermost Limits.

content.description: Sustained 10c with bolts and good pro. There is a second pitch that heads directly up to a small seam and then pulls a roof with some bolts. Bring some small wires and cams if you plan to do this pitch.
content.protection: Small to medium pro, quickdraws, chain anchors.
content.location: The 4th route headed uphill. Starts up steep face, then to some ledge features.
